name: Mercure Rennes Centre Parlement

reviews.text: We just stayed in this hotel, great location, wonderful service, very nice rooms.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel October 31-November 5 2005. The property is located right in the center of town, great location on a quiet side street. You are able to walk to many resturants and shops. Near the Galleries Layfayette. The rooms were small, as most european rooms are, but very clean. The bathroom had a full tub and shower. The amenities were fine. The bed was not the most comfortable for me, but my husband slept fine. There was free wireless internet access during most hours. The daily breakfast, 10 euro consisted of various breads, cheese, fruit, meat (cold), boiled eggs, cereal. It was fine. There is primarily business clientale. There is a bar, but it is pretty quiet. The staff was very professional, not overly friendly, but efficient, and a quick check in and out. There is parking in the hotel garage, no fee for guest, but it fills up fast. We were able to park our car, leave it and walk through town. I was able to book the room for 88 euro per night, which was a great value for the room. I would definitely stay at the property again.
reviews.title: Nice, Quiet Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a fine town for touring but without a surplus of charming tourist hotels, this business hotel offers a perfectly good option for tourists and its weekend specials are unbeatable. I had marked a price of 150 euros per night as the rate for our two night stay and thought it a good rate for the amenities provided and then found that I was actually being charged150 euros (or 75 euros a night) for the TWO nights of our stay--a phenomenol price for what was a good room in a fine location with a terrific breakfast (included)in a lovely, airy breakfast room We loved Rennes and we were thoroughly pleased with the Mercure Pre Botte and its terrific low rates.
reviews.title: Super deal, business hotel fine for tourists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found it hard to find a great hotel on the web in Rennes but as we had to stay in Rennes opted for the Pre Botte based on Trip Advisor comments. The hotel is clean, comfortable, has parking and is centrally located to the attractive city centre. Breakfast service was friendly and food plentiful and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel if you need to stay in Rennes.
reviews.title: Perfectly Good

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel , well placed for city centre and main rail station. Its has clean comfortable rooms.
reviews.title: Well placed hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel occupies the former premises of the 'Ouest-France' newspaper, which provides slightly larger rooms than usual, and is in a great central location for exploring Rennes. It's also got good, secure underground parking, should you be touring the area by car, as we were.
reviews.title: Great place for 'Le Weekend'

reviews.text: We only stayed one night, but wished we'd stayed more as there is lots to see and do in Rennes. The shopping is great, particularly shoes, and the food market is fantastic, all a short walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Very central and great staff

description: Located in a quiet street in the heart of the city, a few minute walk from the historical and cultural sites of Rennes. Nestled in an old printing shop (heritage facade). Bar. Meeting facilities. Rooms for disabled guests.
